fungal infection.Food to Eat: Healthy fat, such as avocados and olives, herbs and spices, high quality protein like, eggs lean meat and fish, low sugar fruit, such as apples, grapefruit, and orange
fungal infection.Food to Avoid: Added sugar, including honey, maple syrup, agave and molasses, Artificial sweetener, fruit in high sugar, processed meat, starchy vegetables like corn, peas and potatoes

allergy.Food to Eat: vitamine C such as citrus fruits, including oranges, kiwi, lemon and grapefruit, bell peppers, strawberries, Tomatoes, white potatoes, cruciferous vegetables, including broccoli, brussels sprout, cabbage and cauliflower
allergy.Food to Avoid: fried food, white bread and pastries, red meat(burgers, steaks) and processed meat (hot dogs, sausage. Fat-heavy spreads, such as butter or margarine

gerd.Food to Eat: non- citrus fruits such as bananas, melons, apples, and pears. Vegetable, lean meat, oatmeal, whole-grain bread, rice and couscous, unsaturated fats from plants and fish
gerd.Food to Avoid: Fatty and fried foods, Spicy foods, citrus, tomato sauces and  vinegr, chocolate, caffeine, onions, peppermint carbonated drinks and alcohol

chronic cholestasis.Food to Eat: Fruits and vegetables, meats, poultry fish and seafood, eggs, beans and peas, tofu and soy. Whole grain, breads, cereals and bakery product, healthy fat and oil
chronic cholestasis.Food to Avoid: Sugars and highly refined foods, such as white bread and corn syrup, processed meats, full fat dairy products

drug reaction.Food to Eat: Crackers, rice, bread, and peanut butter, bananas, Foods Rich in Specific Nutrients, Foods that Promote Digestion
drug reaction.Food to Avoid: Grapefruit, Alcohol, Dairy Products(Milk, yogurt, and cheese), Tyramine-Rich Foods, Vitamin K-Rich Foods, Fruits and Vegetables(grapes, oranges, and bell peppers)

peptic ulcer diseae.Food to Eat: fruits(Apples, grapes, berries, pomegranates), vegetables like leafy greens, bright red and orange vegetables, lean proteins (Skinless poultry, lean beef like sirloin or tenderloin, fish, eggs, tofu, tempeh, dry beans), probiotic foods, whole grains, herbs and spices
peptic ulcer diseae.Food to Avoid: Alcohol, caffeine, milk, certain meet (red meat), high-fat foods, spicy foods, salty foods, chocolate, raw vegetables

aids.Food to Avoid: Raw eggs of foods that contain raw eggs, such as homemade cookie dough, Raw or undercooked poultry, meat, and seafood, milk, dairy products and fruit juices that are unpasteurized

diabetes.Food to Eat: Fruits, Vegetables, Whole grains, Legumes such as beans and peas, low-fat dairy products, such as milk and cheese, heart-healthy fish, avocados, nuts, canola, olive and peanut oils
diabetes.Food to Avoid: Saturated fats such as butter, beef, hot dogs, sausage and beacon, trans fats such as processed snacks, baked goods, shortening and stick margarines, cholesterol such as high fat animal proteins, egg yolks, liver and other organs meat, sodium

gastroenteritis.Food to Eat: Pastas, Rice, Lean meats prepared with little fat, lwow-fat cooked fish, eggs, fresh fruits , or fruits canned in their own juice, cooked vegetables, sugar - free cereals, bread
gastroenteritis.Food to Avoid: Fruit Juice that contain a lot of sugar and fruit drinks, sports drinks such as Gatorade, soft or carbonated drinks, caffeinated drinks, broths and canned or packaged soups, fried foods  or those rich in fat  (delicatessen, potato chips, french fries, pasteries), ice cream, sherbe, popsicles and jellies (such as jell-O)

bronchial asthma.Food to Eat: Carrot, Citrus(Vitamin C, rich oranges, lemons, limes, and grapefruit), Almonds, Salmon (Healthy Fatty fish), Walnuts, Sardines, Oats
bronchial asthma.Food to Avoid: peanuts and Tree nuts, Processed Meats (Sausage, beacon, and salami), Dairy (Milk, yogurt and Cheese), Sulfites

hypertension.Food to Eat: Apricots, Avocados, Melons(cantaloupe or honeydew), Fat-free or low-fat dairy products, Spinach and greens, fish (tuna and halibut), Legumes, Molasses, Mushrooms, oranges/orange juice, potatoes, prune/prune juice, raisins and dates, tomatoes
hypertension.Food to Avoid: Processed meats (Bacon and hot dogs), Canned food with preservatives, High-sodium food such as pickles and chicken strips, fatty meats, especially red meat, vegetable oil and margarine, which are high trans fat, table salt, grapefruit

migraine.Food to Eat: Leafy greens (kale, spinach and collard greens), Nut(almonds, cashews and brazil nuts), beans, pumpkin and chia seed, Omega-3 fatty acids (oily fish such as salmon and mackerel), chia seeds, waluts, soybeans, highfat and low carbohydrate foods (lean meats, eggs, seafood, butter, nut and seeds and nonstarchy vegetables)
migraine.Food to Avoid: Caffeine(Coffee, tea, chocolate), Artificial sweeteners, Alcohol, Chocolate, foods containing Monosodium glutamate(MSG), Cured meats(deli meats, ham, hot dog and sausages), Aged cheeses(feta, blue cheese, parmesan), Fermented foods (Fermented pickles, kimchi, alcohol), soy sauce, sauerkraut, frozen foods

cervical spondylosis.Food to Eat: Fruits and Vegetables, protein food, vitamin D, Omega-3 fatty acids, Antioxidants,
cervical spondylosis.Food to Avoid: Processed foods, saturated fats, and excessive salt and sugar

paralysis (brain hemorrhage).Food to Eat: Fruits, healthy fats (fatty fish, or seafood, nuts, seeds, avocado and extra-virgin olive oil, beans, vegetables, whole grains (farro, spelt, barley, and millet), Herbs and spices, soluble fiber, potassium
paralysis (brain hemorrhage).Food to Avoid: limit salt and sugary foods such as high saturated fat, biscuits, cates, patries, pies, processed meats, commercial burgesrs, pizza, fried food, potato chips, crips

jaundice.Food to Eat: Water, Sodium, Fruit and vegetables, lemons, limes, grapfruits, melon and papayas, potatoes, yams and pumpkins, avocados, ripe tomatoes, garlic with ginger, collard greens with spinach, coffee and sugarcane juice
jaundice.Food to Avoid: Alcohol and caffeine, Processed foods, High-fat foods: Fried foods and greasy meats can strain the liver, Excessive dairy, Non-vegetarian foods

malaria.Food to Eat: Soft, cooked foods like mashed potatoes, rice porridge, and stews, water, juices, and coconut water to prevent dehydration, fish, chicken, or eggs in a light stew or soup, fruits and vegetables, like oranges, papayas, and spinach, beans, milk and dairy product, Honey
malaria.Food to Avoid: Avoid fried, oily, and spicy foods, Limit high-fiber foods like whole grains, sugary, processed foods, pastries, and chip, caffeinated beverages (coffee, tea) and alcohol, Spicy Foods

chicken pox.Food to Eat: Rice, toast, pasta, oatmeal, and soups, Drink plenty of water, coconut water, herbal tea, and low-sugar sports drinks, Bananas, melons, berries, peaches, broccoli, kale, cucumbers, and spinach, Mung bean porridge, lotus seed porridge, brown rice porridge, asparagus, bananas, and other soft food
chicken pox.Food to Avoid: Spicy and Salty Foods, Acidic Foods: Citrus fruits and tomatoes, Popcorn, nuts, seeds, chips, and other crunchy items, Fried Foods. Garlic, chili, ginger, pepper, curry, mustard, dog meat, goat meat, seafood (shrimp, clams, snails, mussels), and certain fruits like lychee, longan, plums, mangoes, and jackfruit should be avoided, as they can be harmful.

dengue.Food to Eat: Water, coconut water, herbal teas (ginger, chamomile), and clear broths, Papaya, pomegranate, oranges, grapefruits, kiwi, and other fruits rich in vitamin C and K, Cooked vegetables like carrots, pumpkins, zucchini, and squash, as well as leafy greens like spinach, Chicken, fish, eggs, and other protein sources, Iron - rich food
dengue.Food to Avoid: Fatty and greasy foods: Fried foods, fast food, and processed meats. Sugary and processed foods: excessive sugar intake and processed items. Caffeinated and alcoholic beverages: Coffee, energy drinks, sodas, and alcohol. Foods that can worsen symptoms: Spicy foods and foods that cause gas (beans, chickpeas, broccoli, etc.). Dark-colored foods: Red, brown, or black foods, as they can confuse the doctor in case of vomiting. Foods that can increase bleeding risk: Aspirin, ibuprofen, and naproxen sodium.

typhoid.Food to Eat: Grains(White rice, pasta, white bread), Vegetables(Boiled or cooked vegetables like potatoes, carrots, green beans, beets, and squash), Fruits(Ripe bananas, melons, applesauce), Proteins (Eggs, chicken, turkey, fish, tofu, and ground meat), Dairy (Yogurt, low-fat or fat-free pasteurized milk, buttermilk, cheese, and ice cream), Fluids(Coconut water, lime juice, bottled water, herbal tea, juice, and broth), Soups
typhoid.Food to Avoid: Whole grains, oats, barley, nuts, seeds, and legumes, Spicy Foods, Fried and oily foods, Raw fruits and vegetables, Vegetables like broccoli, cabbage, cauliflower, and asparagus, Avoid fruits and vegetables that may have been washed with contaminated water

Fiber-rich foods: Whole grains, fruits, vegetables, legumes.

Foods with high bacterial risk: Aged cheeses, raw eggs, raw fish, undercooked meats, and raw peanut butter. 
Foods that may worsen skin inflammation: Processed foods, sugary drinks, and excessive caffeine.
